segments.text: Looking at this kitchen, everything seems so ordinary at first.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman's in her apron, polishing that plate like it's the most important thing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But the sink is full and water's cascading over the edge.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can she not hear it splashing everywhere?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The puddle's growing right under her feet on the slippery floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Now the kids are at it, the boy teetering on that unstable stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He's got his hand deep in the cookie jar, stealing treats.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl's just egging him on, arm outstretched for her piece.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: All this while the water ruins the cabinets below.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The open window shows a nice garden, but inside it's chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't believe they're risking a fall for some cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Someone needs to stop this mess right now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The dishes stacked on the counter might get knocked over too.
segments.speaker: PAR
